meanings.definition: Severe or strict in manner or attitude
meanings.sent1: The teacher gave the harshest punishment for misbehaving.
meanings.sent2: The winter in the northern regions can be the harshest.
meanings.sent3: The harshest librarian in town shushed everyone who whispered.
meanings.sent4: His harshest glare could make even the bravest student quiet down.
meanings.sent5: The harshest rule in the classroom was no talking during tests.

meanings.definition: Unpleasantly rough or jarring to the senses
meanings.sent1: The harshest sound came from the old rusty gate.
meanings.sent2: The fabric was so rough, it felt like the harshest material ever.
meanings.sent3: The harshest noise from the broken speaker made everyone cringe.
meanings.sent4: The harshest wind howled through the night, keeping everyone awake.
meanings.sent5: The harshest taste of the medicine made the child refuse to take it.

meanings.sent1: The harshest punishment for the crime was a lifetime in prison.
meanings.sent2: The dictator ruled with the harshest laws imaginable.
meanings.sent3: The harshest villain in the story met a comical end.
meanings.sent4: The harshest winter froze the entire town in a thick layer of ice.
meanings.sent5: The harshest treatment of animals is never acceptable.
